'''[[Delusional Ideas SD-124|Delusional Ideas]] :'''' Alterations in the content of thought leading to a loss of contact with reality, not shared by the socio-cultural group.

'''[[Hallucinations SD-122|Hallucinations]]:''' Sensory perception without the presence of a detectable object.

question.title: What are the defining characteristics of delusions and hallucinations?
question.description: Alterations in the content of thought leading to a loss of contact with reality, not shared by the socio-cultural group. Sensory perception without the presence of a detectable object.

option_a.title: Alterations in the content of thought leading to a loss of contact with reality, not shared by the socio-cultural group, and sensory perception with the presence of a detectable object.
option_a.description: This option combines the characteristics of delusions and hallucinations, but incorrectly states that sensory perception requires a detectable object.

option_b.title: Sensory perception without the presence of a detectable object, and alterations in the content of thought leading to a loss of contact with reality, not shared by the socio-cultural group.
option_b.description: This option correctly describes the characteristics of hallucinations and delusions, but in a different order.

option_c.title: Both delusions and hallucinations require the presence of a detectable object to occur.
option_c.description: This option incorrectly states that both delusions and hallucinations require a detectable object, which is not supported by the definition.

option_d.title: Delusions are sensory perceptions without a detectable object, while hallucinations are alterations in thought content.
option_d.description: This option incorrectly defines delusions and hallucinations, and also incorrectly states that sensory perception requires a detectable object.

correct_option.title: B
correct_option.description: The correct answer is option B, which correctly describes the characteristics of hallucinations and delusions.
